header.title: Only 30% of Brits know what the gender pay gap is, but do you?
header.postText: Only 30% of the British public know what the gender pay gap is, a study has suggested.', 'According to a survey by YouGov, when people were asked whether the gender pay gap was A: ‘women as a whole being paid less on average than men as a whole’ or B: ‘women being paid less than men for doing the same job’, only 30% selected the correct answer.', 'So which is it?', 'The correct answer is; A: women as a whole are being paid less on average than men as a whole.', 'When questioned, a further 1% answered ‘something else’ and the remaining 5% answered ‘don’t know’.', 'It is calculated by measuring the difference between men’s and women’s average earnings across an organisation or a particular market.', 'In Britain, the overall gender pay gap is 18.1%, meaning men on average earn that much more than women.', 'In comparison, women being paid less than men for doing the same job is a question of equal pay, rather than a pay gap.', 'It is usually much easier to spot, and paying a man more simply for being a man is also illegal in the UK.', 'According to the results, men were more likely to correctly identify what the correct answer was (35%), compared to only one in four women (24%).', 'But the reasons for the gender pay gap are complex, and not easy to tackle in the space of one generation.', 'The gap is significantly wider among the older generations, where women are more likely to have been under regulatory constraints at the beginning of their careers including being banned from certain industries or needing a male relative’s consent to work.', 'Today, women are still more likely to work in lower paid industries, such as care and education.', 'They are also more likely to take time out of work to care for children or relatives and many workplaces do not have the necessary support for them to be able to return to work.', 'Women have also faced discrimination over being hired as they can be deemed more of a ‘risk’ to take time off to have a family than a male candidate.', 'Although it is illegal to not hire someone based on these biases, it can still happen and is often impossible to prove.', 'In April, businesses with more than 250 employers were legally required by the government to publish their gender pay gap in an effort to take action and try to close the gender pay gap.', 'The statistics showed that almost 80% of companies, including public sector bodies, paid men more than women.', 'The highest gender pay gap was from Millwall Holdings PLC, the parent company of Millwall FC, who reported a 80% gap between the two genders.', 'Among well-known names in the top ten were budget airline Ryanair, who had a 71.8% gap.', 'For every £1 men in the company earned, women only earned 28p.', 'It said the disparity was because of the number of UK pilots it employs – 546 are male and only eight are female.
